go by.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if time goes by, it passes
go by.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Things will get easier as time goes by.
As the weeks went by, I became more and more worried.
Hardly a week goes by without some food scare being reported in the media.
hardly a day/week/month etc goes by
These herbs would have been grown for medicinal purposes in days gone by.
go by.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to form an opinion about someone or something from the information or experience that you have
go by.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: You canâ€™t always go by appearances.
If his past plays are anything to go by, this should be a play worth watching.
go by.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to do things according to a set of rules or laws
go by.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Only a fool goes by the rules all the time.
There was no doubt that the referee had gone by the book (=had obeyed all the rules).
